name: EPRI Air Dispersion Tools
short_description:
This project is comprised of three tools for use with the AERMOD dispersion model and the release of the SCICHEM dispersion model.

1. SHARP: The Sub-Hourly AERMOD Run Procedure allows the user to run AERMOD using fine-resolution meteorology.
2. DISTANCE: The DISTANCE_DEBUG tool provides additional output that can be used to diagnose causes for high concentrations. An evaluation of the applicable distance for one-hour applications of AERMOD is also provided.
3. EMVAP: The Emissions Variability Processor allows AERMOD to sample from emissions distributions. A default distribution for SO2 applications and its evaluation is provided.
4. SCICHEM: A version of the SCIPUFF puff model with chemistry. It allows for the simulation of power plants plumes a series of puffs that are transported in the atmosphere while undergoing chemical transformation. SCICHEM can be used for permitting applications and attainment demonstrations.
summary: SCICHEM 3.0b2, EMVAP, SHARP and Distance Study
